cities.name: Brno

Art & Culture.name: ≈†pilberk Castle
Art & Culture.description: A massive hilltop fortress overlooking the city, once a royal castle and later a prison. Today it hosts the Brno City Museum and seasonal exhibitions.

Art & Culture.name: Cathedral of St. Peter and Paul
Art & Culture.description: One of Brno‚Äôs most recognizable landmarks, perched on Petrov Hill. Its twin spires dominate the skyline and its bells ring at 11:00 instead of 12:00 ‚Äî a unique local tradition.

Art & Culture.name: Villa Tugendhat
Art & Culture.description: A UNESCO World Heritage modernist villa designed by Mies van der Rohe ‚Äî a masterpiece of functionalist architecture.

Art & Culture.name: Moravian Gallery
Art & Culture.description: A collection of art museums featuring Czech and international works, contemporary exhibitions, and design pieces across several venues in the city.

Art & Culture.name: Brno Ossuary (Kostnice u sv. Jakuba)
Art & Culture.description: The second-largest ossuary in Europe, located beneath St. James Church ‚Äî a haunting but fascinating historical site filled with centuries-old remains.

Photo Spots.name: Petrov Hill Viewpoint
Photo Spots.description: Offers sweeping views of the Old Town and ≈†pilberk Castle ‚Äî especially magical at sunset.

Photo Spots.name: Zeln√Ω trh (Cabbage Market)

Photo Spots.name: Brno Astronomical Clock
Photo Spots.description: A quirky modern black stone monument on Freedom Square that releases a glass marble every day at 11:00 ‚Äî both mysterious and photogenic.

Food & Nightlife.name: Soul Bistro
Food & Nightlife.description: A stylish bistro serving modern Czech and European dishes with a relaxed atmosphere and creative presentation.

Food & Nightlife.name: Lok√°l U Caipla
Food & Nightlife.description: A modern Czech pub offering local classics like sv√≠ƒçkov√°, goulash, and freshly tapped Pilsner beer.

Food & Nightlife.name: Super Panda Circus
Food & Nightlife.description: A hidden cocktail bar with a playful circus theme and inventive drinks ‚Äî one of Brno‚Äôs most unique nightlife experiences.

Food & Nightlife.name: Bar, kter√Ω neexistuje
Food & Nightlife.description: Translating to ‚ÄòThe Bar That Doesn‚Äôt Exist,‚Äô this iconic spot features expertly mixed cocktails, great music, and a warm vibe.

Nature & Relaxation.name: Lu≈æ√°nky Park
Nature & Relaxation.description: Brno‚Äôs largest and oldest public park ‚Äî a green oasis for jogging, picnics, or relaxing under the trees.

Nature & Relaxation.name: Brno Reservoir (Prygl)
Nature & Relaxation.description: A popular spot for swimming, boating, and nature walks ‚Äî especially beautiful in summer and autumn.

Nature & Relaxation.description: Terraced gardens on Petrov Hill with fountains, flowers, and panoramic views over the city.

Nature & Relaxation.name: Moravian Karst Caves
Nature & Relaxation.description: A short trip from Brno ‚Äî explore spectacular caves and the famous Macocha Abyss, one of Europe‚Äôs deepest sinkholes.

cities.local_food_tip: Try Moravian specialties like sv√≠ƒçkov√° (beef with cream sauce), Moravian sparrow (pork with dumplings and cabbage), and local wines from South Moravia.

full_day.morning: ‚òÄÔ∏è Start your day at St. Peter and Paul Cathedral, then walk down to Zeln√Ω trh for coffee and local pastries.
full_day.afternoon: üè∞ Visit ≈†pilberk Castle and enjoy city views from the ramparts, then explore the Moravian Gallery.
full_day.evening: üåá Have dinner at Soul Bistro or Lok√°l U Caipla, followed by a walk through Freedom Square.
full_day.night: üåô End your evening with creative cocktails at Super Panda Circus or chill at The Bar That Doesn‚Äôt Exist.

spring.highlight: Blossoming parks and ideal weather for city walks.

ideas.name: Lu≈æ√°nky Park Picnics
ideas.description: Relax under blooming trees and enjoy local street food markets.

ideas.name: Villa Tugendhat Tour
ideas.description: See the gardens come alive with spring colors after a tour of this architectural gem.

summer.highlight: Festival season with open-air concerts and lakeside fun.

ideas.name: Ignis Brunensis Fireworks Festival
ideas.description: An international fireworks competition lighting up the skies over the reservoir.

ideas.name: Brno Reservoir Swimming & Boat Trips
ideas.description: Escape the city heat with cool water and scenic cruises.

ideas.name: Wine Tasting in South Moravia
ideas.description: Take a day trip to nearby vineyards for autumn harvest celebrations.

ideas.name: Brno Architecture Walk

ideas.name: ≈†pilberk Winter Walk
ideas.description: See the castle dusted in snow and enjoy peaceful city views.

public_transport_tips.tip: Brno‚Äôs public transport network (DPMB) covers trams, buses, and trolleybuses ‚Äî easy to navigate with tickets available via the DPMB mobile app or vending machines.
Most attractions in the city center are walkable within 15‚Äì20 minutes.
Day passes are great value if you plan to use trams multiple times or visit the reservoir area.

city_events.description: Ignis Brunensis ‚Äî the city‚Äôs famous international fireworks and light festival held over the reservoir.
Brno Day ‚Äî a celebration of the city‚Äôs medieval history with parades, music, and historical reenactments.
Brno Christmas Markets ‚Äî charming lights, wooden stalls, and mulled wine in the heart of the city.

places.name: Freedom Square (N√°mƒõst√≠ Svobody)
places.description: Brno‚Äôs main square ‚Äî a lively gathering place surrounded by historic buildings, caf√©s, and shops.

places.name: Brno Underground Labyrinth
places.description: A network of medieval cellars and passages under the city center ‚Äî great for a fun and mysterious tour.

places.name: Villa Tugendhat
places.description: A modernist architectural masterpiece and UNESCO site ‚Äî advanced booking recommended.

hidden_gems.name: Caf√© Podneb√≠
hidden_gems.description: A cozy caf√© tucked in a courtyard near the park ‚Äî perfect for coffee and cakes under the trees.

hidden_gems.description: A small but fascinating crypt where monks were naturally mummified ‚Äî eerie yet peaceful.

hidden_gems.name: Veve≈ô√≠ Castle
hidden_gems.description: A fairytale castle on the Brno Reservoir ‚Äî reachable by boat, surrounded by forest trails.

cities.name: ƒåesk√Ω Krumlov

Art & Culture.name: ƒåesk√Ω Krumlov Castle
Art & Culture.description: A UNESCO-listed castle complex overlooking the Vltava River ‚Äî the second largest in the Czech Republic. Famous for its Renaissance halls, Baroque theater, and panoramic tower views.

Art & Culture.name: St. Vitus Church

Nature & Relaxation.description: Enjoy gentle rapids and stunning scenery while paddling through one of Europe‚Äôs most picturesque river towns.

Nature & Relaxation.description: A natural park near ƒåesk√Ω Krumlov offering hiking trails, lookout towers, and forested hills with views of the ≈†umava Mountains.

cities.local_food_tip: Try Czech classics like roasted duck with dumplings and cabbage, trout from the Vltava River, and homemade apple strudel. Don‚Äôt miss locally brewed Eggenberg beer!

full_day.morning: ‚òÄÔ∏è Start your day with a walk across Cloak Bridge to the castle, and climb the tower for city views.
full_day.afternoon: üçΩÔ∏è Enjoy lunch at Krcma ≈†atlava, then explore the Egon Schiele Art Centrum and Castle Gardens.

spring.highlight: Flowers bloom around the castle gardens and the town awakens from winter‚Äôs calm.

public_transport_tips.tip: ƒåesk√Ω Krumlov is compact ‚Äî you can explore nearly everything on foot.
Regular buses and trains connect ƒåesk√Ω Krumlov with Prague and ƒåesk√© Budƒõjovice.
If you arrive by bus, the main stop (≈†piƒç√°k or AN) is only a short walk from the Old Town.

International Music Festival ‚Äî classical concerts held in historic courtyards and churches.
Charming Christmas markets and Advent concerts fill the town with festive magic.

places.name: Old Town Square

full_day.morning: ‚òÄÔ∏è Start your day at the V≈ô√≠deln√≠ Colonnade, then stroll along the Mill Colonnade sipping thermal water.

spring.highlight: Blooming parks and gentle sunshine make it the perfect spa season.

ideas.name: Mill Colonnade Walk

public_transport_tips.tip: The local bus system connects all main areas, including spa zones, the Moser factory, and the train station.
The funicular to the Diana Tower runs daily and is included in some spa passes.
Intercity buses and trains connect Karlovy Vary with Prague (2.5 hours).

Traditional Christmas market with lights, food stalls, and festive music.

places.name: V≈ô√≠deln√≠ Colonnade

Olomouc Christmas Market ‚Äî festive lights, wooden stalls, and warm trdeln√≠k pastries.

cities.name: Prague

cities.local_food_tip: Try traditional Czech dishes like sv√≠ƒçkov√° (beef with creamy sauce and dumplings), goulash, and trdeln√≠k pastries. Pair them with local Pilsner beer or Moravian wine!

full_day.morning: ‚òÄÔ∏è Start early with a peaceful walk across Charles Bridge and breakfast at Caf√© Savoy.

public_transport_tips.tip: Use trams and metro operated by DPP ‚Äî fast, reliable, and well connected across the city.
A 24-hour ticket is great value for exploring multiple districts in a day.
Most historic attractions are within walking distance in the Old Town and Lesser Town.
